hours_text:
## Museum Hours

**Monday** | Closed  
---|---  
**Tuesday** | Closed  
**Wednesday** | 12pm–5pm  
**Thursday** | 12pm–8:30pm  
**Friday** | 10am–5pm  
**Saturday** | 10am–5pm  
**Sunday** | 12pm–5pm  
  
**Danforth Art is closed** on the following holidays:  
New Year’s, Independence Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve and Christmas.

**Danforth Art is open on the following Monday holidays** :  
Martin Luther King Day and Presidents Day.

**For School hours** check the Student Info page.

## Admission

**Members** |  Free  
---|---  
**Children Under 17** |  Free  
**Adults** |  $11  
**Seniors** |  $9  
**Students** |  $8  
  
## Special Admission

**Free admission for Framingham residents***  
(with I.D. or proof of residency) on Saturdays from 10am to 12pm.  
Learn more about special membership rates for Framingham residents here.

**Free admission to Members of the following organizations:**  
• AAM (The American Association of Museums)  
• TCAN (The Center for the Arts in Natick)  
• ICOM (International Council of Museums)  
• Mutual One Bank Club Advantage  
• All students and faculty of Framingham State University  
• All students and faculty of Massachusetts College of Art & Design  
• All students and faculty of The School of the Museum of Fine Arts

**Free admission to Members of the following Museums:**  
• Art Complex Museum (Duxbury, MA)  
• Bennington Museum (VT)  
• Cape Cod Museum of Art (MA)  
• Farnsworth Art Museum (Rockland, ME)  
• Fitchburg Art Museum (MA)...
collections_text:
**A New Vision, A New Future**  
**An Announcement from Danforth Art Museum\School**  
After nearly a year of negotiations, the leadership of both Danforth Art Museum\School and Framingham State University has agreed to a thoughtful and mutually beneficial merger, after which Danforth Art will become the Danforth Art Center at Framingham State University. We invite you to read our **NEWS/UPDATES** page for information about the partnership and its impact on the museum and studio art school. [LEARN MORE](/updatesnews.html)

**Head back over to North Hill!**  
We’re delighted to announce that a new installation of _Figuration in American Art: Selections from the Danforth Art Permanent Collection_ is now open at North Hill in Needham, MA. Part II of the exhibition will feature works by Gerrit Beneker, May Stevens, Marion Pooke, Don Eddy (a detail of his _C/VI/D (Then There Were Two)_ is shown above). Admission is free. [LEARN MORE](/exhibits.html)

**Winter Studio Art Classes & Workshops **  
Registration is now open for Danforth Art School’s winter session of studio art offerings for adults, teens, and children. Join us for three and six week classes, one and two day workshops, and more, in a variety of media for students of all levels of experience, from absolute beginners to more experienced artists. [REGISTER NOW](/artclasses.html)
